intro: Paederia scandens, commonly known as the climbing false Solomon's seal, is a tropical vine belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Paederia scandens is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions.
